name: Tuner (fancy)
description: This algorithm provides four simultaneous tuners using an autocorrelation pitch detection method which is fairly CPU heavy but reliable for most signals. For simpler tones, the 'Tuner (simple)' algorithm may be preferred. Microtuning via Scala or MTS is supported.
use_cases: Detecting pitch in complex audio signals
Real-time MIDI note tracking for multiple channels
Octave error correction via track bias adjustment
gui_description: The display shows the detected pitch of active channels as a MIDI note number and cents, alongside an Hz value. A bar grows left or right depending on how flat or sharp the note is relative to its true pitch.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: Sets the range of pitches which can be tracked. Set this appropriately for the lowest note that you need to tune.

parameters.name: Track_bias
parameters.description: An internal parameter of the pitch tracking algorithm, which can help it avoid errors of octave in some circumstances. The default value is recommended in most cases.

parameters.name: Env_threshold
parameters.description: Sets a signal threshold below which no attempt is made to track pitch.
